explains: n. （Rind）人名；（英、德、巴基）林德；（法）兰

sentences.en: "I'll call th' robin up," he said, "and give him th' rind o' th' bacon to peck at."
sentences.cn: “我将把知更鸟叫来，”他说道，“把这熏肉圈给它啄一啄。”

sentences.en: The fruit of this plant has a hard, prickly rind and soft pulp with an offensive odor but a pleasant taste.
sentences.cn: 这种植物的果实，果皮有硬刺，果肉柔软，气味难闻，但味道可口。

sentences.en: Enter Newcastle University biologist Claire Rind.
sentences.cn: 克莱尔·莱恩是纽卡斯尔大学的生物学家。
